description.p: The Spellslinger is someone that enters a situation knowing they'll probably have to come up with a plan on the fly.

they are spry, quick on their feet and are seemingly always in the worst situations. but their ability to consantly improvie and utilize their strange form of magic is what often leads to one if not more solutions to whatever problem they are part of.
Crafty and annoying, the Spellslinger can be the bane of any great villian because "How the hell did you get in here so fast!!!"

Unlike most other caster that rely on their intellect, knowledge or spirit to perform their arcane acts, the Spellslinger stands over their use of simple and fast incantations and large volume of fire.
Untilizing their dexterity and intuition over pure logic or wisdom. their hands move at mesmorizing speeds weaving runes and glyhps of spells that many deeper in the arcane arts overlook.
Spellslingers rely on the easier form of magic, this isnt from a lack of trying but a personal knowledge that even the simplest of tricks can fool even the greatest minds

sticking to cantrips and lower level spells they pride themsleves in their ability to draw more power from them then need to rely on the sheer force of power that many great caster seek through training years in the arcane arts.
Spellslingers are fleeting individauls, always moving and never really enjoying the idea of settlin down. They are wild spirits and often connect to those that dont feel like they belong anywhere.
They often have big dreams and might even daydream of future dangers they might encounter.

You can make a Spellslinger quickly by following these suggestions. First, Dexterity should be your highest ability score, followed by intelligence. Second, choose the Far Traveler background. Third, choose 2 cantrips of choice that you start out with
As a Spellslinger, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per Spellslinger level after 1st
Skills: Choose two from Arcana, Sleight of Hands, Acrobatics, Stealth, Nature, and Investigatiom

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) a component pouch or (b) an arcane focus
(a) a Scholars pack or (b) an explorer’s pack

sheet.description: A Spellcaster that utilizes the lower levels of magic in a varity of means

description.p: Spell save DC = 8 + your Proficiency bonus + Dexterity modifier
Spell attack modifier = your Proficiency bonus + Dexterity modifier

sheet.description: You can prepare {{Spellslinger:spellcasting:prepare}} spells from your spellbook. you can use an arcane focus to cast spells.

description.p: At level 3, as you are becoming more adept with your spells you know add your dexterity modifier to Cantrip damage rolls.
At level 10, the bonus is replaced and you add your Spellcasting modifier to damage rolls.
At level 20, the effect upgrades and you add double your Spellcasting modifier.

sheet.description: Your dexterity modifier is added to damage rolls on Cantrips
Your Spellcasting modifier is added to damage rolls on Cantrips
Double your Spellcasting modifier is added to damage rolls on Cantrips

description.p: Starting from level 5, on your turn, when you cast a Spell or a Cantrip as an action you can cast Cantrip as a followup using your Bonus action.
When you Cast a spell or a Cantrip as an action, you can cast an additional Cantrip as a Bonus Action
Starting from 2nd level you pick your Slinger Specialty. This is a trade you learnt or made yourself that personalizes the arts of Spellslinging to the individual.
When a creature makes a Saving Throw against a Cantrip effect that would deal damage, even on a Succeesful save the creature still takes half damage

sheet.description: Cantrips saving throw effect that deal damage still deal half damage on Succeesful saving throws

description.p: Your skill with Cantrip has reached a point where even if you miss the spell effect still tries to hit something.
Cantrip attack rolls that miss Ricohet, making another attack roll at a creature within 15ft of the original target.
Additionally, Cantrips that require a saving now have a 15ft radius where the effect is also applied.

Starting from 2nd you gain more control over the cantrips you cast, letting choose its damage type.
When casting a cantrip spell that deals a form of Damage you choose to alter the damage type it deals from the following:
( Fire, Cold, Lightning, Acid )

sheet.description: When Casting a cantrip that deals damage you can choose to alters it damage type to the following: Fire, Cold, Lightning, Acid

description.p: Becoming more proficient at altering cantrips you gain access to more damage types you can choose from when using "Runic Alteration"
The additional damage types are ( Thunder, Magical Physical (Slashing, Piercing, Bludgoening))

sheet.description: Additional damage types can be choosen when selecting the damage type for cantrips: Thunder, Magical Physical

description.p: You have master the arts around altering the effects of Cantrips, gaining acess to more damage types you can choose from the "Runic Alteration"
The additional types are ( Necrotic, Radiant, Psychic )

sheet.description: Additional damage types can be choosen when casting cantrips: Necrotic, Radiant, Psychic

description.p: Even when you fail you succeed. Missing an attack might be good for the bad guy. But it's better for you.
When you miss an attack using a Cantrips, the target of the attack has disadvantage on the next Saving Throw you impose on it.
When the Target of a Cantrip that requires a Saving Throw succeeds on the Save, The next attack you roll make against that Target is at Advantage.

Having cast cantrips so much you gained a deeper understanding of their function and can innately alter their range to your overal benefit.
description.li: Doubles the range of normal Cantrips.
Cantrips with the range of Touch now have a 15ft Range.
Cantrips with the range of Self now have a Range of Touch.
